meanings.definition: To import or export goods secretly and illegally.
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to smuggle the stolen jewels across the border.
meanings.sent2: The criminals attempted to smuggle drugs into the country.
meanings.sent3: The spy had to smuggle the top-secret documents past the guards.
meanings.sent4: She managed to smuggle her pet hamster into the movie theater.
meanings.sent5: The pirates tried to smuggle the treasure chest past the navy ships.

meanings.definition: To bring something into a place or country secretly and illegally.
meanings.sent1: The smuggler successfully smuggled the contraband through customs.
meanings.sent2: People often try to smuggle snacks into the movie theater.
meanings.sent3: The students had to smuggle the forbidden book into the library.
meanings.sent4: He managed to smuggle his favorite snacks into the school.
meanings.sent5: She attempted to smuggle her phone into the concert venue.

meanings.definition: To transport (someone or something) secretly and illegally.
meanings.sent1: The criminals planned to smuggle the hostages out of the building.
meanings.sent2: The underground network helped smuggle refugees across the border.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to smuggle his assistant onto the stage without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: The rebels tried to smuggle weapons into the country.
meanings.sent5: She had to smuggle the stray kitten into her house without her parents knowing.
